The Dataphor Reference provides information relating to the basic tools of Dataphor Toolset. It contains detailed listings for the D4 language and Derivation.
Introduction
The Dataphor Reference contains reference documentation for the Alphora Dataphor Toolset which includes both the Alphora Dataphor Data Access Engine (DAE) and the Alphora Dataphor Frontend.
What's in This Manual
This manuual contains the following four chapters:
Chapter 1
"D4 Language Guide" describes the D4 Language with syntax, description, and examples
Chapter 2
"Dataphor user Interface Language Reference" describes the markup used to define user interfaces using the Dataphor Frontend.
Chapter 3
"System Library Reference" provides a detailed reference for "sytem" operators and tables.
Chapter 4
"Derivation Tags Reference" provides a detailed reference for the tags used in the process of Derivation.
Additional Resources
Additional information may be obtained from the following sources:
The on-line help.
Dataphor User's Guide contains information about the overall purpose of Dataphor and the role of the Dataphor Data Access Engine.
Dataphor DAE Developers Guide contains information about the Dataphor Data Access Engine.
Dataphor Frontend Developers Guide contains information about the Dataphor Frontend.
Texts such as An Introduction to Database Systems by C. J. Date (Addison Wesley Longman) contain information about the Relational Model and its significance.
The.NET Framework MSDN documentation, included with the .NET Framework SDK, provides information about the technology on which the Dataphor DAE is built.
